group.name: Physics
group.string: Simulate realistic object physics, powered by Box2DWeb.

group.name: properties
group.string: Enable to make object have infinite mass. Ideal for scenery.
How the object collides in the physics simulation.
Prevent the object rotating when hit.
The object friction coefficient, between 0 and 1.
The object elasticity (restitution or 'bounciness') coefficient, between 0 and 1.
Coefficient to slow down motion over time, between 0 and 1.
Coefficient to slow down rotations over time, between 0 and 1.

group.name: acts
group.string: Apply a force on the object.
The name or number of the image point to apply the force at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} force {0} toward ([i]{1}[/i], [i]{2}[/i]) at image point {3}
Apply a force on the object towards a position in the layout.
The X co-ordinate to apply the force towards.
The Y co-ordinate to apply the force towards.
The name or number of the image point to apply the force at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} force {0} at angle {1} at image point {2}
Apply a force on the object in a particular direction.
The angle, in degrees, to apply the force towards.
The name or number of the image point to apply the force at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply an impulse to the object, as if it were suddenly struck.
The name or number of the image point to apply the impulse at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} impulse {0} toward ([i]{1}[/i], [i]{2}[/i]) at image point {3}
Apply an impulse on the object as if it were suddenly struck towards a position in the layout.
The X co-ordinate to apply the impulse towards.
The Y co-ordinate to apply the impulse towards.
The name or number of the image point to apply the impulse at, or 0 for object's origin.
Apply {my} impulse {0} at angle {1} at image point {2}
Apply an impulse on the object as if it were suddenly struck at an angle.
The angle, in degrees, to apply the impulse at.
The name or number of the image point to apply the impulse at, or 0 for object's origin.
The torque to apply to the object.
Apply a torque towards an angle.
The magnitude of the torque to apply.
The angle, in degrees, to apply torque towards.
Apply a torque towards a position in the layout.
The magnitude of the torque to apply.
The X co-ordinate in the layout to apply torque towards.
The Y co-ordinate in the layout to apply torque towards.
Set the rate the object rotates at.
The angular velocity to set, in degrees per second.
Create {my} distance joint from image point {0} to {1} image point {2}, damping ratio {3}, frequency {4}
Force this and another object to stay a fixed distance apart, as if connected by a pole.
Name or number of image point on this object to attach joint to.
Name or number of image point on other object to attach joint to.
The joint damping ratio, from 0 (no damping) to 1 (critical damping)
Create {my} revolute joint at image point {0} to {1}
Hinge another object to a point on this object.
Name or number of image point on this object to hinge object to.
Set the force of gravity on all objects in the world.
The new force of gravity to set.
Set the way the physics engine steps the simulation.
The stepping mode. 'Fixed' guarantees same results every time but is not framerate independent; 'framerate independent' adjusts to the framerate but may give different results each time.
Set {my} world stepping to {0} velocity iterations and {1} position iterations
Iterations for the velocity constraint solver. Lower is fast and inaccurate, higher is slow and accurate.
Iterations for the position constraint solver. Lower is fast and inaccurate, higher is slow and accurate.
Set the current motion of the physics object.
The X component of the velocity to set, in pixels per second.
The Y component of the velocity to set, in pixels per second.
Set the density of the physics object.
The new object density. Only has effect when 'Immovable' is 'No'.
The new object friction coefficient, between 0 and 1.
The new object elasticity (restitution or 'bounciness') coefficient, between 0 and 1.
Set the coefficient to slow down motion over time.
The new object linear damping, between 0 and 1.
Set the coefficient to slow down rotations over time.
The new object angular damping, between 0 and 1.
Set whether the object has infinite mass (immovable)
Set whether the object has infinite mass (immovable).
Create {my} limited revolute joint at image point {0} to {1}, from {2} to {3} degrees
Hinge another object to a point on this object and limit the range of rotation.
Name or number of image point on this object to hinge object to.
The lower angle of rotation allowed, in degrees.
The upper angle of rotation allowed, in degrees.
Enable or disable collisions with another object using the Physics behavior.
Choose another object type with the Physics behavior to enable or disable collisions for.
Enable or disable collisions with the given object type.

group.name: exps
group.string: The X component of the object's current velocity, in pixels per second.
The Y component of the object's current velocity, in pixels per second.
The object's current angular velocity, in degrees per second.
The object's physics mass, which is its collision area multiplied by its density.
The X co-ordinate of the object's center of mass.
The Y co-ordinate of the object's center of mass.
The current density of the physics object.
The current friction of the physics object.
The current elasticity ('bounciness') of the physics object.
